newsitem.title: CHINA: China puts 30,000 T aluminium plant into operation.
newsitem.headline: China puts 30,000 T aluminium plant into operation.

text.p: The largest aluminium plant in China's central Hubei province formally began operations this week, with annual output expected to reach 30,000 tonnes of aluminium ingots, the China news service said on Thursday.
The Xingfu Corporation Aluminium Plant, begun in March 1995, had total investment of 489 million yuan ($58.9 million), it said.

The corporation had also built a 150-megawatt thermal power plant and planned a 30,000-tonne electrolytic aluminium project and a production line for 50,000 tonnes of aluminium plate and 10,000 tonnes of aluminium foil, it said.

The finished project would have total output capacity of 160,000 tonnes of aluminium products and total annual output value of three billion yuan, it said. It gave no date for when the plant would be fully operational.
